skillTree.localised_description: This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from all of their years spent barking orders at their ship.

effects.description: Effect range: +30% for "Avast Ye!" and "All Hands Hoay!"
Cooldown: -50% to "Avast Ye!" and "All Hands Hoay!"

skillTree.localised_description: This Captain never sails sober. The sea goes one way, Captain goes the other. Makes the rockin' bearable.

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Grog Carriers units
	(Lord's army)

Effect range: +50% for "Liquid Encouragement" for Grog Carriers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Although a black-hearted cutthroat of the first order, he is also notoriously a man of his word, which makes him rare indeed and sought after as a mercenary.
As far as the tide stretches inland, so too does the Sea God's influence.

effects.description: Ward save: 15% when fighting at sea

skillTree.localised_description: "I'd rather give my tenth coin to Ranald than risk losing the remaining nine."

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Edvard is a dangerous man, a hard man and a grizzled survivor, albeit his adventures have left him grizzled, scarred and maimed, but only a fool would think him slowed down by his injuries.

Manann's Blades have fought as often on the battlefields of the Old World as they have aboard privateer vessels plundering the coast of Sartosa. In recent years, under Van Der Kraal's command, the Manann's Blades have gained a reputation as dark as their captain.

effects.description:
Attribute: Devastating Flanker for all Pirate Deckhands units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +15 for all Pirate Deckhands units
	(Lord's army)

Enables "Dirty Fighting" contact effect (reduced Speed, Melee Attack and Melee Defence) for all Pirate Deckhands units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Van Der Kraal has escaped death a great many times over the years, fought against the dark-mist kindred of the Cursed Marshes and lived, raided the Norscan coast with fire and sword and it is said even survived shipwreck on the infamous Vampire Coast of Lustria and somehow returned to tell the tale.

effects.description:
Increased plunder from encounters at sea
	(factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who break their word to Edvard, especially employers have quickly discovered that he makes a revenge an art form.
"Yes, they’re from the east. Annoying, yet useful - their hides, particularly…"
If there's swash to be buckled, this one will be right at the front, in the thick of the fray.
Strike hard, strike true.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Assuming you get it right and your shot doesn't turn to flowers on impact, these little extras tend to bring advantage.
Death is always just a shot away.
"It's got a few secret ingredients. No, I won't tell you what they are, but the results will speak for themselves."
"Get more ammo up here, NOW!!!!!!!!"
A clever arrangement of lenses makes the target seem just that bit closer.
Some beings just want to see the world burn.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

skillTree.localised_description: Fire, to destroy all that you have done; fire, to end all you've become.
Such methods are blunt and crude in the extreme, but still very, very effective.

effects.description:
Enemy casualty replenishment rate: -10%
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: If there's duty to be paid, rest assured that this one will find a way around it.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -15% for all buildings
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: The beasts of the world belong to everyone, never a single individual.

effects.description:
Leadership: -8 for enemy monstrous units

Missile resistance: -10% for enemy monstrous units
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Why would one pretend to be what he is not? There are many reasons, none of them innocent.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

skillTree.localised_description: If you're offering enough, most people eventually start to see things your way.

Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors
	(Heroes in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "They'll never know the difference, even up close."

effects.description:

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: As sailors, deckhands are experts in seamanship and ship operations. As pirates, they also quickly become proficient in swordplay and in using a variety of weapons.

skillTree.localised_description: "Listen very carefully, me hearties, I shall say this only once… Quiet! Stromfels' stinkin' breath!"
The Pirate crew are drawn together by the lure of the sea as well as the lure of plunder.

skillTree.localised_description: "Now listen up an' listen good… here be the plan…"
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
The only law worth noting in Sartosa is the so-called “Pirate's Code”. It stresses both personal freedom and loyalty to your captain, crew, and ship (in that order).
This one has survived calamities and wounds uncounted, although they may have lost a few bits and pieces of themselves along the way.
If it's not tacked down, this one'll 'ave it and kill anyone who gets in their way.

Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: "You'll never find such a crew - villainous scum, the lot of 'em. I certainly wouldn't want to be facing 'em in the thick of battle!"

skillTree.localised_description: There's a time in every sailor's, er, life when the black flag seems like the best, if not the only option.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Take care of your ship and she will have a care for your wellbeing in return.
Such things keep the eternal players' of this world alive.
Beware those who sail under the black flag - they give no quarter and never, ever give up the chase.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Edvard Van Der Kraal is the dreaded field commander of the infamous Manann's Blades, a powerful mercenary regiment owned and operated via intermediaries of the shadowy Merchant Lords of Marienburg.

effects.description: [HIDDEN] This faction does not attack settlements with its own foreign slots
Immune to diplomatic penalties from trespassing
Can replenish and recruit in foreign territory

Immune to High Seas, Reef and Storm attrition
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: One of Van Der Kraal's most precious prizes, taken from a weird temple located in Lustria. Rumours suggested it was previously occupied by a crazed female-only cult who worshipped a snake god, but those are only rumours, that can't be true..

effects.description:

	(local region)
